details.description: Engineered a multifunctional rover for the University Rover Challenge (URC), focusing on terrain adaptability, scientific payload integration, and remote autonomous navigation. Project Oddity emphasized modularity, quick-repair architecture, and rugged performance in simulated Martian environments.

Developed a fully autonomous drone platform using a custom-built Attitude and Heading Reference System (AHRS) for precise orientation estimation, enabling stable navigation and control in dynamic environments.

Integrated and optimized the CI engine and powertrain for the Fraternity of Mechanical and Automotive Engineers [FMAE] of  DKDC team, focusing on fuel efficiency, performance tuning, and durability testing, adhering to competition standards.
Developed the visual identity and frontend architecture for Nexawings International, a software solutions provider start-up.
Developed a multi-DOF robotic arm with real-time control, integrating servo motors, inverse kinematics, and sensor feedback for automated manipulation tasks.
